snippet: Some call the move to soon close 10 percent of public libraries in Britain an austerity measure, others a transformation project. Really it's a crisis.
abstract: Some call the move to soon close 10 percent of public libraries in Britain an austerity measure, others a transformation project. Really it's a crisis.
lead_paragraph: LONDON - A couple of years ago, after a reading in Karachi, I told off a young man who was asking me to sign a pirated copy of one of my books. Piracy is destroying publishing in Pakistan, I told him. He said he understood but added that because pirated books are cheaper he could buy more of them. It's not as if Karachi is filled with public libraries, he said.

headline.main: The Demise of the Public Library
